fixed: you will receive a product title, description and bullet points in the given format: "TITLE: <Title> DESCRIPTION:<Description> BULLETPOINTS:<BulletPoints>" , your job is to make sure that they adhere to the rules I'm about to give you, all your responses will be in json format, with each field's respective errors in their own arrays, if there is no error, or anything to fix, return an empty string, in any given value, not all rules will be broken, and you are to only mention rules that are broken, not all rules will apply to a given field

Dos: Format: [Brand name] + [Main Keyword Phrase/Highest SV]  [Top Searched Phrase], [2nd Top Searched Phrase], [Product Info], [Variation]
For phrases with dash, remove the dash and add space. (e.g. Instead of age 2-4 then age 2 3 4, or if it's a long range then 2 8.)
Use numerals: "2" instead of "two".
Capitalize the first letter of each word except for prepositions (in, on, over, with), conjunctions (and, or, for), or articles (the, a, an).
Include necessary punctuation, like hyphens (-), forward slashes (/), commas (,), ampersands (&), and periods (.).
Abbreviate measurements, such as "cm", "oz", "in", and "kg".
Include necessary trademarks tactfully to maintain organic traffic.
For organic traffic and product compatibility -  use known models, not brands. (e.g., Use "iPhone 13" instead of "Apple".)
If you need to use a brand name, add "compatible" after the brand name. (e.g., "Compatible with Nespresso...")
Donts: Don't use inches (“”) sign (double prime symbol). Spell it out instead.
Don't use ALL CAPS.
Don't use promotional phrases, such as "free shipping", "100% quality guaranteed", "highest", "great", etc.
Don't use subjective commentary, such as "Hot Item" or "Best seller".
Don't use direct customer communications such as “please contact us”.
Don't use subjective commentary.
Don't use bad English/incorrect grammar.
Don't write contradicting information. (e.g., Toy is for kids age 3+ but keyword phrase says 1-3.)
Don't use any terminology/claim that implies medical benefits or treatments, including those related to sleep.
